38836976.review:
The Body VR: Journey Inside a Cell is a free edutainment VR game.  It worked on Win 10, looked good, sounded good, played good.  I learned some about the cell.  Has a human body model that you can look at different systems and get some names of parts.  

Try it, maybe you might learn something.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AGW1NA42O-8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zTsDXMyBEY

http://www.336gamereviews.com/the-body-vr-journey-inside-a-cell-review/

https://uploadvr.com/body-vr-brings-vr-education-htc-vive-today/

38671443.review:
A short educational tour of a cell, with an added interactive model of the body you can examine.

A good use of the medium, though probably aimed at a younger crowd.

38475520.review: Not only educational, but a great demo to ease people into VR if they are prone to motion sickness. Would love to see this sort of thing in all classrooms- students would be excited to learn instead of bored.

38466166.review:
Very cool simulation inside the human body in VR.
A lot of languages are supported with full audio which is a rare case nowadays.
It was interesting and educational so thumbs up!

38007030.review: Ein tolles Beispiel dafür, wie man VR für Bildungszwecke nutzen kann. Wirklich großartig. Unbedingt anschauen!

37887243.review:
Cool educational little tour.

Worth the download.

36388013.review: 非常棒的一个教育体验 如果有更多的互动就更好了

36277969.review: its awesome for what it is but I would gladly pay for this if it had more content like more in depth cell signaling and microtubular movement. As a molecular and cellular bio student i need all the help i can get.

35925424.review: Absolutely Awesome.  This needs to be in all Schools!!

34981442.review: 太牛逼了！！！还有中文语音！！！

34943209.review: It's more like a short demo but it shows the potential of the VR in educational applications. I felt a taste of the future with this !

34864726.review: So sieht Lernstoff in der Zukunft aus, hat mir richtig gut gefallen. Aufjedenfall auch gut als VR Demo zum Vorzeigen geeignet.

34842568.review:
An interesting educational journey. 11 minutes of multiple individual, short chapters with interesting visualizations.

It left me wondering how close the visualizations actually are to reality and how much was simplification or stylizing. The narrator explains some names and facts, but the actual activities and interactions are sadly not presented in interactive/animated detail. I would have loved the presentation to go deeper.

Still, worth the watch with some interesting visualizations.
